item.title: Avengers: Secret Wars Rumored To Have A Big Connection To Venom
item.description:
Highlights

  • Rumored links between Venom and Spider-Man in Avengers: Secret Wars may introduce symbiote consequences for Tom Holland's Spider-Man.
  • A black symbiote suit could amplify Peter Parker's darkest urges in Avengers: Secret Wars.
  • Avengers: Secret Wars may have a role for Venom when it premieres in theaters on May 7, 2027.

Avengers: Secret Wars is rumored to connect to Tom Hardy's Venom and potentially answer a lingering question that has remained unresolved since Spider-Man: No Way Home .

Hardy's Venom movies, part of Sony's Spider-Man Universe, finally crossed over with the Marvel Cinematic Universe when the titular character was transported to the MCU in the Venom 2 post-credits scene . A few months later, Spider-Man: No Way Home 's post-credits scene showed Hardy being transported back to Sony's Spider-Man Universe but inadvertently leaving a piece of the Venom symbiote behind in the MCU . Fans have yet to see the consequences of this scene play out, but a new rumor claims Avengers : Secret Wars will finally address the matter.

Related
Did Deadpool & Wolverine Find Inspiration From A Spider-Man Scene?
Fans eagerly await Deadpool & Wolverine's premiere, especially after a recent trailer hinted at a parallel to another Marvel classic, Spider-Man.

According to Cosmic Circus' Alex P , the symbiote left behind in Spider-Man: No Way Home 's post-credits scene will have a role in Avengers: Secret Wars . Unfortunately, no details were provided, as Alex P. only replied, "Yes," to a question from a fan on X. However, Avengers: Secret Wars is expected to be partly based on the limited comic book series of the same name from the '80s, so fans can speculate that the symbiote's role in the film will involve Tom Holland's Spider-Man.

The original version of Secret Wars depicts how Spider-Man first obtained his black symbiote costume, though he was initially unaware it was an alien species. The symbiote would eventually bond with Eddie Brock, giving birth to the fan-favorite villain Venom. While Hardy's Eddie Brock has already bonded with the symbiote, Spider-Man: No Way Home 's post-credits scene provides Marvel Studios a quick and easy way to give Holland's Peter Parker the black suit for Avengers: Secret Wars .

Giving Holland's Spider-Man the black symbiote suit could have consequences for the character. The symbiote can famously alter their host's personalities by amplifying their darkest urges, which was famously adapted on screen in the '90s Spider-Man animated series and Sam Raimi's Spider-Man 3 , in which Peter Parker rejects the symbiote after it drives him to the edge of darkness. Holland's Peter Parker is in a lonely place now that the entire world has no memory of him and Aunt May has died. So, he could be vulnerable to the temptation provided by the symbiote. Of course, Marvel Studios may refrain from adapting this aspect of the symbiote storyline, considering Avengers: Secret Wars is already expected to be packed with an ensemble cast of characters.

On the other hand, Avengers: Secret Wars is rumored to reboot the MCU , meaning Marvel Studios could restart Peter Parker's story or introduce an Eddie Brock variant to adapt Venom's origin story properly. However, this is speculation, as Avengers: Secret Wars plot details have not been confirmed by Marvel Studios, so when it comes to the Venom symbiote playing a role in the film, fans need to manage their expectations and not set them too high.

Avengers: Secret Wars is scheduled to premiere in theaters on May 7, 2027.

More
The Marvel Cinematic Universe Introduced Too Many Superheroes
While the comics have a million heroes to choose from, Marvel's cinematic model is struggling to balance its ever-expanding roster.

Source: Alex P./X

item.title: Helldivers 2 Reveals Polar Patriots Warbond With New Weapons and Gear
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Polar Patriots Warband update arrives in Helldivers 2 on May 9 with new weapons, customization options, and emotes.
  • Earn medals in the Warbond to unlock rewards like weapons and armor.
  • Look out for the AR-61 Tenderizer, SMG-72 Pummeler, and other new items in the upcoming Polar Patriots Warbond update for Helldivers 2.

A new Helldivers 2 update is on the way, this time with the newly announced Polar Patriots Warband releasing on May 9. This content update brings a plethora of new items and weapons into the fold for use in missions in Helldivers 2 , as well as a ton of new customization options.

As is the case with a majority of online-focused multiplayer games, Helldivers 2 features a progression system. Helldivers 2 calls this pass a Warbond , tasking players with earning medals in order to acquire in-game rewards. These rewards range from new weapons to a wide range of helmets, capes, colors, and other customization options. Players can pick and choose what to unlock at their own pace, as long as they have enough medals to purchase them. These Warbonds come in both a free and premium version, with Helldivers 2 recently revealing the game's next pass that players will soon be able to progress through.

Related
Helldivers 2 Has Reached an Impressive Milestone, Analyst Reveals
Helldivers 2's PC success drives it to top Sony's charts, signaling a shift in gaming distribution trends with its simultaneous release strategy.

Dubbed the Polar Patriots Warbond, this new pass releases May 9 and adds quite a few new items to Helldiver 2 's collection of weapons , including the AR-61 Tenderizer assault rifle, the SMG-72 Pummeler SMG, and the PLAS-101 Purifier. The new Warbond also includes several new secondary weapons, like the G-13 Incendiary Impact flame grenade, the gas-operated, semi-automatic P-113 verdict, and Motivational Shocks, which act as a revive for downed Helldivers. Several new pieces of polar-themed armor are also included in this new Warbond like the CW-36 Winter Warrior and Cw-4 Arctic Ranger sets. Capes are one of the most popular customization items in Helldivers 2 , with this new Warbond featuring several new versions for players to unlock as well.

Helldivers 2 Announces New Warbond Items

  • AR-61 Tenderizer: High caliber assault rifle with limited magazine size
  • SMG-72 Pummeler: Slower rate of fire than other SMGs but concussive rounds leave enemies dazed
  • PLAS-101 Purifier: The longer players hold the trigger, the bigger the damage.
  • CW-36 Winter Warrior: Allows players to blend into snowy environments with perfect camouflage.
  • CW-22 Kodiak: Tested by patriotic volunteers. Grants Passive Fortified boost
  • CW-4 Arctic Ranger: Utility belt that grants Passive Scout Boost

Also included in the upcoming Polar Patriots Warbond update are several brand-new emotes. Helldivers 2 already features quite a few emotes , some of which can make for hilarious in-game moments. Soon, Helldivers 2 players will be able to "rock out" with the Mime Instrumentation emote, request incoming chat with the Call the Helldivers emote, and search for new voters with the Distribute Ballots emote. Upon release, the new Polar Patriots Warbond will be found on players' Acquisitions panel located inside their Super Destroyer ship, which acts as a central hub for Helldivers 2 .

Helldivers 2' s Polar Patriots Warbond is one of many content updates planned for the future, with developer Arrowhead Studios keeping a close eye on the game's community. Recent updates to Helldivers 2 include giant mechs and new weapons. Players can also use a wide range of items called Stratagems, which can help turn the tide of battle during a mission. While firepower is generally the most important factor in success, cooperation, teamwork, and communication are all core to the Helldivers 2 experience, with the game managing to develop an incredibly dedicated fan base as a result.

item.title: Bethesda's Todd Howard Responds to Starfield Criticisms
item.description:
Highlights

  • Mixed reviews for Starfield highlight divided opinions among players, with criticism directed towards design and lack of innovation.
  • Todd Howard addresses criticisms, acknowledging disappointment but urging players to approach Starfield with fresh expectations.
  • Bethesda is working on improving Starfield with upcoming patches, mod support, and an upcoming DLC.

Bethesda Game Studios executive producer Todd Howard addressed the criticisms of players left disappointed by Starfield . Since its release in 2023, the open-world sci-fi RPG has had trouble reaching the same level of universal acclaim as previous Bethesda titles, with longtime fans of the developer still divided on their opinions regarding their experience. While some enjoyed their playthrough of the title, other players found issues with several elements of Starfield 's design and have not been shy of criticizing its developer for its perceived shortcomings.

At the time of writing, Starfield 's Steam overall reviews are hovering at a "Mixed" rating of 61%, and its Xbox Games store page retains an average review score of 3.4/5 stars. Though the game is far from an outright critical or financial failure, scores indicated that Starfield players are nevertheless finding it difficult to fall in love with the IP in the same way fans did with Bethesda's The Elder Scrolls or Fallout series . The criticisms of Starfield focus on a variety of issues, but a sizable portion of negative reviews were directed at the game's setting. Users claimed the title lacked a strong creative vision and engaging narrative, with some further stating that it failed to innovate on Bethesda's established formula.

Related
Starfield Reveals Patch Notes for Big May 2024 Update
Bethesda pulls the curtain back on the patch notes for the big May 2024 update that's in the works for Starfield.

Now, over half a year after its release, Howard discussed the polarized reception for Starfield during an interview with Greg Miller at Kinda Funny Games. When asked how the studio responded to some of the negative reviews, the Bethesda executive first assured fans that developers were listening closely to their feedback. He stated that they understood why some fans were disappointed that Starfield didn't offer the same flavor of exploration as previous Bethesda games.

Todd Howard Responds to Starfield Critics

Howard additionally sympathized with players who were excited to land and explore Starfield 's various planets but emphasized that the developers' vision for a sci-fi video game necessitated certain trade-offs. He further encouraged fans to go into Starfield without letting their experience with previous Bethesda games color their expectations, claiming that they should let each of the franchises stand out in their own unique ways.

While Starfield is still on shaky ground, there is hope for Bethesda's newest IP, with additional patches and content already in the production pipeline. Howard notably claimed developers were still working on adding official mod support for the title and hinted that more information would be made available soon. He also revealed a release window for the Shattered Space DLC , which is reportedly scheduled for release sometime in Fall 2024.

item.title: Stellar Blade Features Cameo From a Veteran Game Designer
item.description:
Highlights

  • Stellar Blade features a cameo by veteran game designer Jake Song, known for his work on Lineage, a popular MMORPG in South Korea.
  • The game has been well-received with a Metacritic rating of 82 and is one of the highest-rated PS5 titles.
  • Celebrity cameos in games are not uncommon, with industry figures like Jake Song appearing in popular titles like Stellar Blade.

Stellar Blade developer Shift Up has announced that the highly rated PS5 exclusive title stars Jake Song, a veteran game designer, in a cameo appearance. Song, whose digital model appears in Stellar Blade , is a leading name behind one of the biggest games in Shift Up's home country.

Last month, Stellar Blade hit the shelves to an impressively positive reception among fans and critics alike. The action-adventure game received a high Metacritic rating of 82 and became one of the highest-rated PS5 titles . Most recently, it has attracted the interest of fans over an in-game cameo that features one of the major personalities in gaming.

Related
8 Games To Play If You Like Stellar Blade
Stellar Blade has many features that make it unique, but these games may satisfy those looking for another gaming experience like it.

As confirmed in a Twitter post, Stellar Blade contains a high-profile cameo by a top game designer, Jake Song, who has been in the industry for decades. Further, Shift Up acknowledged Song's contribution towards "the world's longest servicing (sic) MMORPG," Lineage , and thanked him for showing up in the game. The post also accompanied a picture of Song alongside his digital avatar in Stellar Blade .

Stellar Blade Features Cameo from Jake Song

In Shift Up's home country, South Korea, Lineage is one of the most popular game franchises, with millions of fans in the country. The fantasy-themed MMORPG series from NCSoft kicked off way back in 1998, spearheaded by game designer Jake Song, and has spawned multiple entries since then. Thanks to the immense success of Lineage , Song holds a special place in the Korean game industry.

Over the years, various celebrities have made an appearance in games , giving fans more reasons to look forward to playing those titles. From chart-topping singer Snoop Dogg to legendary comic book artist Stan Lee, a wide spectrum of notable personalities have collaborated with developers to have their likeness appear in games. Between Drew Carey in 2000's The Sims and Kit Harington in 2016's Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare , games have featured star cameos for a long time.

Apart from mainstream celebrities, big names from the game industry itself have also played cameo roles in popular titles. A few recent examples would be game director Hideo Kojima appearing in Cyberpunk 2077 and game journalist Geoff Keighley featuring in Kojima's own Death Stranding . The cameo of Jake Song in Stellar Blade adds yet another name to the list of industry figures that have appeared in games.

item.title: 7-Eleven is Releasing Its Own Handheld
item.description:
Highlights

  • 7-Eleven surprises fans with Tetris merch collab, offering $30 handheld gaming device in iconic Slurpee cup design.
  • Tetris, a classic video game released in 1985, continues to evolve with new versions like Tetris 99.
  • Merchandise from 7-Eleven collaboration includes shirts, bags, caps, and stickers.

Major convenience store chain 7-Eleven has announced a surprising merch collaboration with Tetris , which includes the brand's very own handheld gaming device featuring the iconic '80s video game. Fashion and video game collaborations, like the many Pokemon merch partnerships with known brands , are no longer anything new in 2024, but Tetris may have been one of the last titles anyone expected to have merch of.

Tetris was released nearly 40 years ago in 1985 by Russian engineer and game designer Alexey Pajitnov, and it's one of the most recognizable video games in the whole world with thousands of knockoffs and variants. It still finds a way to adapt to the times, with one of the game's most notable evolutions being Tetris 99 , a free-to-play online multiplayer battle royale version that dropped back in 2019 for the Nintendo Switch.

Related
10 Puzzle Games Like Tetris
Tetris is a classic among puzzle games, and the following titles have a charm that's similar to its timeless formula.

7-Eleven announced that the handheld gaming device goes for $30. The Tetris portable is housed in a case designed after the brand's iconic Slurpee cup that glows with a colored backlight, packing a full-color 1.8-inch screen and built-in speaker. The device is powered by three AAA batteries, but can also be played in a wired mode using a USB-C cable. However, it's not actually available yet as the 7-Eleven website says it's still coming soon with no clear release date.

7-Eleven Slurpee + Tetris Handheld Game Device Specs

  • Trademark Slurpee cup-inspired design
  • Glowing top
  • 1.8-inch color screen
  • Built-in speaker
  • Powered by three AAA batteries or USB-C cable (not included)
  • Release date: TBA

For Tetris fans, there are also other kinds of merch available as part of the collaboration. There are a number of shirts, a tote bag, two cap designs, sweatshirts, and stickers that bear both the Tetris and 7-Eleven branding. The designs look pretty good, and can give other fashion collaborations like Japanese brand Uniqlo has with franchises like Tekken a run for its money.

The last time the game made the news, it was because a 13-year-old superfan managed to get to the end of Tetris earlier this year. The game technically has no ending as the objective is to rack up the score, but gamer Blue Scuti played so much that he forced Tetris to get to its "kill screen" on level 157, a glitch that happens when specific color combinations render blocks invisible.

The game also enjoyed renewed relevance in 2023 thanks to Apple TV releasing a Tetris movie starring Kingsman actor Taron Egerton as Pajitnov. The intense thriller biopic, which was a dramatized version of Pajitnov's life and work as the creator of Tetris , received rave reviews, scoring 81% fresh on Rotten Tomatoes and even getting a few awards nominations.
